thread.title: Arsenal vs Bayern Munich: Arsene Wenger reveals why he dropped Theo Walcott | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal vs Bayern Munich: Arsene Wenger reveals why he dropped Theo Walcott | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal vs Bayern Munich: Arsene Wenger reveals why he dropped Theo Walcott | Metro News
text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 7:40 pm Theo Walcott has been dropped for the clash with Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger says Theo Walcott still has a part to play in the side’s clash with Bayern Munich despite being dropped to the bench. 
The England international was dropped in favour of Granit Xhaka for the tie at the Allianz Arena with Wenger opting to play Alexis Sanchez as a lone frontman. 
There had been speculation that Wenger would drop Mesut Ozil but the Frenchman confirmed before the clash in Germany that the playmaker will operate behind Sanchez as a ‘second striker’ in a 4-4-1-1 formation. 
Arsenal have failed to reach the the last-8 in each of the last six years but Wenger has explained why he’s opted for a more defensive-minded side tonight. Ozil will play as a second striker (Picture: Getty) 
‘We usually play the second leg here [Allianz Arena] so tonight is a psychological problem,’ said Wenger. 
‘We want a strong defensive performance [but] we have to go fowrard and get the right balance because Bayern have a lot of possession and we need to defend together 
‘I will play with four midfielders with Ozil as a second striker tonight. It is a big opportunity for him.’
